subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Trolley Problem: The Dilemma That Won't Die
description: Learn The Trolley Problem: The Dilemma That Won't Die in one minute.

hook.text: A runaway trolley will kill 5 people. You can pull a lever to divert it, killing 1 instead.

buildup.text: Philippa Foot (1967) created the trolley problem to test moral intuitions about killing vs. letting die.

discovery.text: Variation: instead of a lever, you push a large man off a bridge to stop the trolley. Same math, but most people refuse.

twist.text: The difference: personal physical violence feels wrong even when the numbers are identical.

climax.text: The trolley problem isn't just academic: triage medicine, self-driving cars, & military ethics all face exactly this.

punchline.text: Math says pull the lever. Your gut says don't push the man.

quiz.question: Why do most people approve of pulling the lever but not pushing the man, even though the numbers are identical?
options: Personal physical violence triggers stronger moral intuitions than impersonal actions
